headline: Vent over Pedestrian Bridge archway
description: Not fully sure what this is ventilating within the archway. There are two, one on either top corner.

headline: Design Center 7th floor water fountain drain
description: A slightly different take on the central water fountain drain, with three elongated holes that seem to serve as tabs holding it in place.

headline: Identifying portion of Boston sewer grate
description: A mysterious string of characters are stenciled into this sidewalk grate, likely referring to some infrastructure beneath.

headline: Design Center vestibule drain
description: Seems to exist to prevent flooding from the Providence River, although it's so clogged I'm not sure how effective it would be.

headline: Fleet Library exterior drain
description: A coin-shaped disc of metal about the size of my head, this adorns the exterior of the library alongside a series of pipe attachments.

headline: Westminster Street TD Bank intercom grille
description: Dented and worn, this microphone or speaker grille seems to have a long history. All but one screw have been removed, and additional fasteners have been added in new locations.

type: INDIA  DUMP NO WASTE  DRAINS TO WATERWAYS  SIF  GENERAL FOUNDRIES
headline: 169 Weybosset Street parking lot sewer grate
description: I appreciate the silhouetted fish on this grate's border, and its symmetrical layout of curved rectanglular holes.

headline: Westminster Street TD Bank ATM speaker grille
description: Despite its irregularity, this grille has a consistent count of 12 holes per row, redistributed in length across each row.

headline: 89 Eddy Street intercom grille
description: This speaker, smooth and encased in brushed metal, has a double-layered grille structure, with an interlocking net under the main horizontal ports.

headline: Village Green Charter School intercom grille
description: Reminiscent of HAL 9000, this intercom features a no-frills, unstaggered arrangmeent of circular holes.

headline: Providence World War I Memorial sewer grate
description: Over time, this grate has fused with the surrounding grass. Today it looks less like a structural imposition and more like a natural portal.

headline: White Electric Coffee floor grate
description: Appears to have remained from when the building that now houses White Electric served some other purpose. It's the only one I've encountered that layers one grate shape within another.

headline: White Electric Coffee wall vent
description: The intricate wrought iron design must have been recently painted over in a contemporary bright red color. This vent allows a partial view into White Electric's kitchen.

headline: CIT Building bathroom ceiling duct
description: Rarely do I look up while using the bathroom, but one day I discovered this directly above me, looking like a spa hair dryer.

type: 3/4 CRESLINE PVC SCH 480 PSI AT 73º F PVC 1120 NS-F PW-G ASTM D1785-21 PPFA 09221
headline: Rhode Island State House exterior stone vent
description: Its integration into the stonework of the building suggests it has been around for a long time, but the PVC piping seems to be a more recent addition.

headline: CIT Building lobby water fountain vent
description: Designed to dissapate whatever minimal heat is generated by the water fountain's pump. Possibly also to avoid moisture buildup outside normal zones.

headline: CIT Building elevator ceiling vent
description: Its effectiveness is clearly hampered by the years of dust caked into each hole. The elevator has not been inspected in the last 2 years, so I doubt it has been cleaned in that time.

headline: CIT Building 5th floor radiator cover
description: A classic rounded radiator cover, with raised, semi-rectangular ports. These have not yet been enabled this fall, but I suspect their first use is coming within the month.

headline: CIT Building lobby HVAC vent
description: This entryway box is inlaid into the drywall, with a seemingly small footprint for a device that could heat an entire lobby.

headline: Stedman Lofts Kitchen sink drain
description: A standard issue drain plug, this one has issues falling into a position where it no longer effectively drains, holding water in the sink.

headline: Design Center vestibule wall vent
description: Impressively long, this one could be a method of increasing temperature control as visitors ascend stairs.

headline: Village Green Charter School side door accordion gate
description: I have never seen anyone enter or exit the door behind this screen, but it is ivusally effective at blocking entrance when deployed, and conveniently smaller at other times.

headline: Sewer grate outside Orange Street Washington Trust Bank
description: Even within one intersection, multiple shapes and manufacturers of sewer grates exist side by side, possibly a product of accumulated time.

headline: CIT Building lobby water fountain drain
description: Bearing a resemblance to the WiFi symbol, this drains water off-center, allowing for a greater height and width of water stream.

headline: CIT Building bathroom sink drain
description: Freshly used to drain soapy water, its hexagonal arrangement pairs nicely with the circular pipe beneath.

headline: CIT Building 5th floor HVAC duct
description: Exposed ducts like this one make apparent the heating and cooling functions of a building, and impose an industrial sensibility on the space.

headline: Sewer grate outside Westminster Street Berkshire Bank
description: A pair of matched sewer grates to cover a longer cavity, with very detailed model information on each.

headline: Tree root cover at intersection of Westminster and Orange Streets
description: Although never perfectly set, the four-quadrant design that radiates from the tree's trunk is a nice touch.

headline: CIT Building intercom grille
description: Bearing signs of wear, this intercom has a clear distinction between those holes covering the speaker and those covering the microphone.

headline: Weybosset Street concrete stanchion vent
description: Initially unclear, I assume this vent's purpose is to either dissapate heat from an incandescent bulb within the stanchion or provide additional sewer ventilation.

headline: Providence Optical exterior side vent
description: This simple square vent's paint finish belnds in with the surrounding brickwork.

headline: CIT Building bathroom floor drain
description: The radiating pattern of arcs draws attention to vent and drain manufacturer Josam's simple wordmark.

headline: Fleet Library elevator speaker grille
description: Sitting flat against the brushed metal of the elevator panel, this speaker unit can be activated in emergencies.
